current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To require the Secretary of Health and Human Services, in
		  consultation with the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency and
		  the Secretary of Energy, to conduct a study on the public health and
		  environmental impacts of the production, transportation, storage, and use of
		  petroleum coke, and for other purposes.

committee-name.#text:
Committee on Health, Education, Labor,
			 and Pensions

cosponsor.#tail:
)
			 introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

short-title.#text:
Petroleum Coke Transparency and Public
			 Health Study Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

In the past
			 several years, United States crude oil refineries have grown their coking
			 capacity to accommodate the conversion of heavy crude oils into refined
			 petroleum products.

As coking
			 capacity has grown, the domestic production of petroleum coke is expected to
			 grow, leading to increases in the storage, transportation, and use of the
			 material.

In Detroit, piles of petroleum coke have
			 been stored in the open air on the banks of the Detroit River.

State regulators, communities, and industry
			 stakeholders would benefit from a complete understanding of petroleum coke and
			 the potential impact on public health and the environment related to the
			 production, transportation, storage, and use of petroleum coke.

header.#text:
Study of
			 petroleum coke public health and environmental impacts

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Secretary of Health and Human
			 Services

Administrator of the Environmental
			 Protection Agency

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
the
			 results of a study concerning petroleum coke that shall include the
			 following:

text.#text:
Not later than 180
			 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the

An analysis of
			 the public health and environmental impacts of the production, transportation,
			 storage, and use of petroleum coke.

An assessment of
			 potential approaches and best practices for storing, transporting, and managing
			 petroleum coke.

A quantitative
			 analysis of current and projected domestic petroleum coke production and
			 utilization locations.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall be carried out using
			 the best available science with the solicitation of readily available
			 information from appropriate State agencies, nonprofit entities, academic
			 entities, and industry.

			 website the results of the study conducted under
